adjective.description: Capable of being pointed out; that can be pointed to or at; (hence) visible, apparent. rare.
Capable of being pointed or aimed; specifically (of a telescope, gun, etc.) that can be pointed at an object; easy to point, rotatable.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in John Bradford (c1510–1555), evangelical preacher and martyr. From point + -able.
